feature.title: A “Second Home” in Danger of Collapse
feature.subhead: Philadelphia’s Chinatown restaurants sit at the crux of anti–Asian sentiment and the COVID–19 recession—and pay a steep price.
feature.author: Amy Xiang

in_the_kitchen.title: Philadelphia Restaurateur Ellen Yin on Female Empowerment in the Food Industry
in_the_kitchen.subhead: Restaurateur and Wharton alum (W'87) Ellen Yin shares how women–owned businesses are rewriting the narrative of the COVID–19 pandemic.
in_the_kitchen.author: Aidah Qureshi

in_the_kitchen.title: Grassroots Food Truck is Planting Seeds in the Philadelphia Community
in_the_kitchen.subhead: Founders and chefs Troy Harris and Kareem Wallace provide more than just delicious food.
in_the_kitchen.author: Arielle Stanger

in_the_kitchen.title: Meet Middle Child, A Deli Where Justice is On the Menu
in_the_kitchen.subhead: Middle Child owner Matt Cahn never set out to be an activist. Yet his sandwich shop is shaking up the food industry.
in_the_kitchen.author: Beatrice Forman

in_the_kitchen.title: Crust Vegan Bakery: "A Business Built on Beliefs"
in_the_kitchen.subhead: This bakery was able to open a new storefront, keep paying its workers, and donate to local organizations during the pandemic.
in_the_kitchen.author: Emily White
